captions.text: Hey guys, it’s Ro!
Welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

I got so many requests from you guys to make
something else Harry Potter related.

And, it’s cold outside, I’ve been drinking
a lot of hot apple cider, so I thought,

let’s combine these ideas and let’s make
Golden Snitch Caramel Apple Cider!
Let’s get started!

The things you will need, will be: 3 cups
of regular flour, 1/2 a teaspoon of

almond extract, 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract,
1 egg, 2 teaspoons of baking powder,

1 cup of butter, which is 2 sticks, and 1
cup of regular sugar. You’ll also

need 1/4 cup of light brown sugar and some
salted caramel toppings,
om yum, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum!

8 cups of spiced cider, I just bought a big
jug at the store.

And, some whipped cream, 2 mixing bowls, a
little hand mixer, a cookie sheet

with a piece of parchment paper. A whisk,
a tear shaped cookie cutter,

2 gold cups, I’ll put some links down below
to different sites where you can find

gold cups, and if you can’t find gold you
can use yellow, or anything that will

look like the golden snitch. white cookie
icing, and now let’s put it all together!

The first thing that we’re gonna do is make
our side of the cup wing cookies.

I’m using a really yummy recipe, it’s
a vanilla almond sugar cookie recipe.

Om mum, mum, mum, mum! And, the first thing
that we’re gonna do is in this mixing

bowl we’re gonna sift together our flour
and baking powder.

Next in the second bowl we are gonna cream
together our butter and sugar.

So put all the butter in, make sure it’s
room temperature, and put all your sugar in.

Then you’re gonna beat it till its light
and fluffy. Now add both of your

extracts, vanilla and almond, and your 1 egg.
Then we’re gonna mix again until
everything is smooth and combined.

Now you’re gonna slowly add in your flour
and then mix. I like to add it in thirds.

Once your dough is mixed up you’re gonna
take a little bit of flour, sprinkle it

over a flat surface, so that it won’t stick.
Plop it down, you’re gonna flatten

it out. Take a rolling pin, sprinkle a little
flour on top, and then roll it out.

Now to make the wings you’re gonna take
your tear shaped cookie cutter, and,

we’re gonna cut ‘em out, a whole bunch
of ‘em. and remember you’re gonna need

2 for every cup. And then remove the excess
dough, set it off to the side so we

can make some more. And then, we’re gonna
take this little jobber, I found it

at the craft store Michaels, it’s got these
different cutting patterns and

I picked one that was really jagged, it just
went up, down, up, down, up, down

up, down to look like the bottom of the wing,
like little feathers.

So what you’re gonna do is at the corner,
you’re gonna line it up, and

you’re gonna cut all the way across. Then
you’re gonna move them over
to your baking sheet.

Once you’ve got your cookie wings all cut
out, we are gonna take this cutting

knife and we’re gonna cut angled notches
into the side so it’ll sit on the
side of your cookie.
Maybe I’ll have a little snaeck.

Once you’ve got all the notches cut out,
we are gonna put these

cookies in the freezer for 10 minutes to chill.
This will help them keep their

shape while they’re baking. And, we’re
gonna heat our ovens to 350 and bake

for 10 minutes. After your cookies are done
baking, give them plenty of

time to cool, and then, we are going to decorate.
I’ve got some vanilla

cookie icing, and I just put it in a little
plastic baggie and then put a

number 2 tip at the end for a little bit more
control. And now we’re gonna ice

the top of our cookies. The first thing that
we’re gonna do is draw an outline

all the way around the wing, and then fill
it in. You can also use a toothpick

to shape the icing for detail. I let the cookie
icing set for about 10 minutes

to harden, and now I’ve switched the tip.
I put a number 1 tip, so it’s a

little bit smaller, and now I’m just gonna
draw little lines so it looks a little
bit more like the Golden Snitch wings.

Now that we’re done decorating our cookies,
we are gonna make our
Caramel Apple Cider!

The first thing that you’re gonna do is
in a medium sized saucepan we are gonna

add 8 cups of spiced cider. Then we’re gonna
add 1/4 cup of our light brown sugar,

and a 1/4 cup of our salted caramel topping.
Now we’re gonna take our pot

over to the stove, we’re gonna turn it on
medium heat and we’re gonna stir

frequently until everything is dissolved and
it starts to simmer.
And then it’s ready to serve!

Now we’re gonna put everything together,
I’ve got 2 cups out, but if you have a

bunch of friends coming over just use as many
as you’d like.

Oh this smells so good! Alright, using a ladle,
I’m just gonna carefully pour our

hot caramel apple cider into this little cup. Now
you put a little whipped cream on top.
Ooooooohh!

And, I put a little bit of the salted caramel
topping into a little squeezy bottle.

This is optional, you don’t have to do this,
I just love caramel.
Oh my gosh! Look how cute that is!

And now, you’re just gonna take your winged
cookies, and we’re gonna put 'em on each

side and then I'll flip it around so
you can see it.

Aaaaah! And now you can make as many as you’d
like.
Ta-da!

We made Golden Snitch Caramel Apple Cider
today, thanks you guys for suggesting

something Harry Potter themed! I love Harry
Potter! These were really fun

to make. If you guys make these or any version,
please send me pictures. I love

to re-post them and re-blog them. I just get
a big kick out of seeing your
baking creations! It makes me happy!

I’ll be posting lots of pictures on Facebook,
Tumblr, Instagram and Twitter,

if you want to check ‘em out. And, if you
have any other ideas for any other

Nerdy Nummies please let me know! Leave me
a comment down below and I will do
my best to make it happen.
Thanks again you guys, bye-bye!
I wish I knew a spell to start baking.
Expecto Sugar… Romus
Oh my gosh, I’m a bad wizard!
